original: AND WHEREAS  Reseller has represented that it is qualified and desires to act as a reseller of certain of Diversinet ’s products within a certain defined territory, and agrees to use its best efforts to market and sell such products in such territory;
ollama_generated: AND WHEREAS Seller hereby represents that they possess the necessary qualifications and express their willingness to function as a vendor for some of Diversinet's goods within a designated region, but shall have discretion regarding the extent of effort deployed in marketing and selling such products within said territory.

original: 1. Appointment Subject to payment of the Annual Minimum Commitment ( “AMC” - defined herein), Diversinet hereby grants to Reseller an exclusive, non - transferable and non -assignable right to market, sell, and sub -license those Diversinet products listed in Schedule 2 (the “Products”) within the territory listed in Schedule 3 (the “Territory”) to Canadian headquartered companies, and governmental and broader public sector entities located in Canada.  Reseller’s customers (the “Customers ”) are defined as those organizations/enterprises that will market and manage the end -users of the Products (the “End-Users”). Reseller acknowledges and agrees that it does not have the right to assign sub -resellers under this Agreement outside of the Territory, except with the prior written consent of Diversinet.
modified: 1. Grant of Rights: Upon fulfillment of the Annual Minimum Commitment ( "AMC" - as defined herein), Diversinet grants Reseller a non-exclusive, transferable, and assignable right to distribute, market, and sub-license certain Diversinet products listed in Schedule 2 (the "Products") within the territory specified in Schedule 3 (the "Territory") to entities headquartered in Canada, as well as Canadian governmental and broader public sector organizations. The customers under this agreement (the "Customers") are defined as any organizations/enterprises that will promote and manage the userbase of the Products (the "End-Users"). Reseller understands and accepts that it may assign sub-distributors within the Territory, but only with written consent from Diversinet prior to such assignment. This provision allows for flexibility in Reseller's operations by broadening the scope of assignable sub-resellers, while still ensuring Diversinet's approval.

original: (i) Reseller ceases carrying on its business, or if a petition shall be filed, an order shall be made or an effective resolution is passed for the winding -up, dissolution or liquidation of Reseller.
ollama_generated: (i) In the event that Reseller voluntarily discontinues operations, or if a petition is filed and an order is granted, a resolution is successfully passed, or proceedings are initiated for the restructuring, reorganization, or dissolution of Reseller, the parties acknowledge this as a triggering event for the termination of this agreement.

original: (c) Termination under Subsection 4(a) shall trigger a phase -out period during which Reseller may continue to provide products and services to Customers.  Such phase -out period shall be the longer of (i) the remaining term of the agreement between the Reseller and its Customers, and (ii) 18 months.
ollama_generated: (c) Upon termination under Subsection 4(a), the wind-down period allows Retailer to persist in offering products and services to Clients. This wind-down duration will extend for the longer period between (i) the remaining contract tenure between the Retailer and its Clients, or (ii) a span of 18 months following termination, whichever is greater. During this phase, the Retailer shall not be obliged to offer any new products or services, and it shall not be held responsible for any service level agreements beyond those already in place at the time of termination.

original: (b) Unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, delivery of the Products shall take place via electronic transmission or by courier, and will take place within two (2) Business Days of a written request or purchase order for software and within five (5) Business Days for a standard appliance.  Custom built appliances or software are subject to evaluation and delivery date will be communicated after assessment.  “Business Day” shall mean 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (Eastern Standard Time), Monday through Friday, excluding all statutory holidays observed in the Province of Ontario in Canada.  Delivery will be F.O.B. Diversinet ’s facility.  Reseller shall have fifteen (15) calendar days after the later of (i) the delivery of any of the Products by Diversinet; or (ii) any applicable evaluation period; to inspect the Products and ensure their substantial compliance with the corresponding documentation.  Unless Reseller notifies Diversinet within such fifteen (15) day period that any of the Products fail to substantially comply with the relevant documentation, such Products shall be deemed accepted.  In the event Reseller rejects any of the Products, Reseller shall give Diversinet written notice of rejection, specifying in reasonable detail the basis for such rejection.  Diversinet will use commercially reasonable efforts to correct any nonconformance and re -deliver such Products to Reseller.
ollama_generated:
(b) In the absence of a mutual agreement between the Parties, transmission of the Goods may occur electronically or via a courier service. Delivery times are as follows: software purchase orders will be fulfilled within five (5) Business Days, and standard appliances within two (2) Business Days. For custom-built appliances or software, the delivery date will be determined post-assessment, which may extend beyond the initial estimated timeframe. "Business Day" shall refer to hours between 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., Eastern Standard Time, Monday through Friday, excluding holidays observed in the Province of Ontario, Canada. The point of origin for delivery will be Diversinet's facility.

Upon receipt of the Goods from Diversinet, the Reseller shall have up to fifteen (15) calendar days to examine them and confirm their substantial compliance with the accompanying documentation. If the Reseller fails to notify Diversinet within this timeframe about any non-compliance, the Goods will be considered accepted. Should the Reseller choose to reject any of the Goods, they must provide written notice to Diversinet, outlining the specific reasons for rejection in a clear and detailed manner. Upon receipt of such notice, Diversinet will make reasonable commercial efforts to rectify any issues and resend the Goods to the Reseller.

In essence, this clause outlines the delivery expectations, inspection timelines, and rejection procedures related to goods provided by Diversinet to the Reseller.

original: (c) Technical Expertise.  Reseller and its staff shall be conversant with the technical language conventional to the Products and similar technologies in general, and will develop sufficient knowledge of the industry, of the Products and of products competitive with the Products (including specifications, features and benefits) in order to explain in detail to potential Customers and End Users the differences between the Products and competitive products and services.
ollama_generated: (c) Technical Proficiency. While Reseller and its staff are not required to be experts in every aspect of the Products or related technologies, they shall possess a working understanding of the technical terms commonly associated with the Products and similar technologies. Furthermore, Reseller shall make a reasonable effort to familiarize itself with the industry, the Products, and competing products (including specifications, features, and benefits), in order to provide potential Customers and End Users with an overview of the key differences between the Products and comparable offerings. This understanding does not require a comprehensive expertise but rather a basic level of knowledge sufficient for general discussions about the Products.

original: 1. Support (a) Services.  Diversinet may provide, upon written agreement between the parties, the server hardware, physical environment, including physical security, HVAC and power for the server hardware, all as required to provide the Products as described in Schedule 2.  Diversinet may also provide internet connectivity, by being responsible for network operation and availability from the public Internet up to the termination cables at the network interface card on the server hardware.  Diversinet shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain connectivity, through the public Internet, between the server hardware and the wireless network operators or other network on which an End User’s device operates.  Diversinet specifically excludes any responsibility for any connectivity between a network operator and a wireless device, including any SMS, SMTP, or other connectivity.  The products, their related service objectives and each Party ’s related responsibilities in respect thereto are to be more fully described in a separate agreement.
ollama_generated:
1. Support Services. Upon written agreement between the parties, Diversinet may supply, but is not obligated to guarantee, the server hardware, its surrounding physical environment including security, HVAC, and power necessary for proper operation as per Schedule 2's Product description. Diversinet will also provide internet connectivity, with responsibility for network management and upkeep from the public Internet point of connection to the network interface card on the server hardware.

However, it is essential to understand that Diversinet assumes no liability for maintaining or ensuring connectivity beyond the point of connection to a wireless network operator or any other network on which an End User's device operates. Moreover, Diversinet absolves itself from any responsibility regarding any connectivity issues between a network operator and a wireless device, encompassing SMS, SMTP, or other connections.

The Products, their service targets, and each Party’s related responsibilities will be detailed in a subsequent agreement.

original: (d) Updates.  During the Term, Diversinet will provide updated versions of the Products ( “Updates”). Updates shall be designated by a version number with a higher number to the right of the decimal point ( e.g., version 1.4 is an Update to version 1.2), but do not include New Releases or Custom Releases (which are designated with a higher number to the left of the decimal point, or at the end with a letter, respectively).  Prior to delivering any Updates, Diversinet may require Reseller to sign a revised schedule if any additional grants or licenses are required for an Update.
ollama_generated:
(d) Upgrades and Modifications: Throughout the Term of this Agreement, Diversinet retains the discretion to introduce upgrades and modifications to the Products (collectively, "Upgrades"). These Upgrades shall be identified by a version number where the number to the right of the decimal point is incremented (e.g., 1.4 follows 1.2), excluding Major Releases or Custom Developments (which are denoted by a higher number preceding the decimal point or a letter suffix, respectively). Diversinet reserves the right to require Reseller's acceptance of revised terms and conditions in writing prior to delivering any Upgrades that may necessitate additional grants or licenses.

In this version, the clause has been rewritten to shift responsibility from Diversinet to the Reseller by stating that Diversinet retains discretion for introducing upgrades and modifications, and requiring Reseller's acceptance of revised terms and conditions in writing before delivering any Upgrades necessitating additional grants or licenses.

original: (f) Beta Versions.  Diversinet may provide Reseller with access to Beta Test versions of Updates to Products as described in paragraph (d) above.
ollama_generated:
(f) Access to Beta Versions. Upon Diversinet's discretion, as detailed in paragraph (d) above, Reseller may be granted access to pre-release versions of Updates for the Products, labeled as Beta Test builds.

In this revised clause, the obligation for Diversinet to provide Beta Test versions has been changed to a discretionary action, implying that while they may offer it, there is no guarantee or obligation to do so.

original: (g) Update Input.  Diversinet will give special consideration to Reseller ’s feature requests for future versions of the Products.
ollama_generated: (g) Consideration of Feature Requests - While Diversinet will review Reseller's suggestions for potential inclusion in future iterations of the Products, it is not guaranteed that all requests will be implemented or prioritized. The ultimate decision on which features to include remains solely within Diversinet's discretion.

original: 1. ASP Sales The Reseller may sell the Products as an Application Service Provider ( “ASP”) sales model.  Under an ASP model, the Reseller shall provide the Products through computer -based services to End Users over a network.  The Reseller shall be responsible for providing, at the Reseller ’s sole cost and expense, the infrastructure, network, hosting environment, support and/or website.  Reseller warrants and guarantees that Diversinet shall have no obligations, representations or guarantees to the End User for sales made by the Reseller under an ASP sale.
ollama_generated:
1. ASP Sales Model
In this arrangement, it is understood that the Reseller holds the prerogative to market and distribute the Products via the Application Service Provider (ASP) model. In this context, as the service provider, Diversinet will offer the necessary computing services for the End Users, while the Reseller's responsibilities include managing the infrastructure, network, hosting environment, support, and/or website.

However, it is crucial to acknowledge that by adopting the ASP sales model, the Reseller assumes full responsibility for any warranties, guarantees, or commitments made to End Users regarding the purchased Products. Diversinet shall not bear any obligations, representations, or guarantees to the End Users arising from transactions initiated by the Reseller in this manner.

original: (iii) approved for release by written agreement with the other Party;

original: (a) Each of the Products operates in substantial accordance with its documentation ( “Operation Warranty ”). With respect to the Operation Warranty, Reseller ’s sole remedy, and Diversinet ’s sole obligation, shall be to cause the Product to operate substantially in accordance with its documentation in a timely manner.  All Products shall be virus -checked prior to delivery to Reseller.
ollama_generated:
(a) Each of the Products will function substantially as described in their respective documentation, hereafter referred to as "Operation Guarantee". It is important to note that the extent of Diversinet's responsibility and the remedies available to the Reseller under this Operation Guarantee are limited to Diversinet making reasonable efforts to ensure the Products function substantially according to their documentation in a prompt manner. The onus is on the Reseller to verify the absence of viruses upon receiving the Products prior to their use.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility for virus checking from the seller (Diversinet) to the buyer (Reseller), and also clarifies that Diversinet's obligations are limited to making "reasonable efforts" rather than an absolute guarantee of performance, thereby weakening the obligation.

original: (c) The availability of the MobiSecure™ Strong Authentication service depends on many factors, including Customer ’s connection to the Internet, End Users ’ connection to the Internet, the availability of the Internet and the Internet backbone and equipment that, by its nature, is not fault tolerant.  Diversinet does not and cannot control the flow of data to or from Diversinet ’s network and other portions of the Internet.  Such flow depends in large part on the performance of Internet services provided or controlled by third parties.  At times, actions or inaction of such third parties can impair or disrupt Customers ’ connections to the Internet (or portions thereof).  Although Diversinet will use commercially reasonable efforts to take all actions it deems appropriate to remedy and avoid such events, Diversinet cannot guarantee that such events will not occur.  Accordingly, Diversinet shall have no responsibility for any failure to meet the requirements hereunder, with respect to performance issues, including without limitation: (i) caused by factors outside of Diversinet ’s reasonable control; (ii) that result from any actions or omissions of Customers, End Users or any third parties; (iii) that result from Customers ’ equipment and/or third party equipment (not within the sole control of Diversinet); (iv) caused by any act or failure to act by Customer or as a result of any Third Party Software.

(b) Infringement Indemnity . Diversinet shall diligently defend, indemnify and hold Reseller harmless, at its own expense, any action, loss, cost or expense brought against Reseller to the extent that it is based upon a claim that Reseller ’s use of the unmodified Products as permitted herein infringes upon a third party ’s intellectual property rights, and will pay the resulting costs, damages and legal fees finally awarded against Reseller through settlement, judgment, arbitration, mediation or otherwise in such action that are attributable to such claim, provided that:
ollama_generated: (b) Intellectual Property Indemnity. Reseller shall have the primary right and responsibility, at its own expense, to manage any actions, losses, costs, or expenses arising from a claim that its use of the unmodified Products, as permitted herein, violates a third party's intellectual property rights. In such instances, Diversinet will cover the resulting costs, damages, and legal fees that are ultimately awarded against Reseller through settlement, judgment, arbitration, mediation, or other means, only to the extent that these expenses exceed the amounts Reseller has successfully recovered in defending such claims.

original: (c) Should any of the Products become, or in Diversinet ’s sole opinion is likely to become, the subject of any third party intellectual property infringement claim, Reseller shall permit Diversinet, at Diversinet ’s sole option and expense, to:
ollama_generated:
(c) If, in Diversinet's reasonable belief, any of the Products may potentially be infringing upon a third party's intellectual property rights, Reseller shall grant Diversinet, at Diversinet's sole discretion and expense, the right to:

This revised clause shifts the burden of potential intellectual property infringement from Diversinet to the Reseller by making it their responsibility to determine if there is a potential issue. Additionally, it gives Diversinet the option to take action, rather than an obligation. This change may help mitigate risks for Diversinet in case of any third-party intellectual property disputes.

original: Message Generator The Message Generator is an extension of the messaging tool in the Physician ’s Tool above, used to create user reminder messages based upon reminder criteria and the user records in the repository for recurring action requirements.  Examples include recurring tests (i.e. PAP, colonoscopy, recurring blood work supporting medications), reminders about health and lifestyle choices, medication reminders.) 2. MobiSecure ® Strong Authentication MobiSecure ® Strong Authentication is a fully automated, OATH -standards based strong authentication server product. It is available as a fully configured appliance or a packaged software product and is designed to be easy to deploy and easy to use for high -volume Internet or wireless - based strong authentication. Its supported clients operate on mobile phones, personal computers, USB stick and can also be embedded into microchip or smart card technologies.
ollama_generated:
1. User Reminder System: This is an integral part of the messaging feature within the Physician's Tool, designed to craft user notifications based on specified reminder parameters and relevant user data from the repository for recurring tasks. These reminders may pertain to various aspects such as recurrent tests (e.g., PAP, colonoscopy, regular blood work related to medications), health and lifestyle suggestions, and medication alerts.

  2. MobiSecure Authentication: Serving as a robust authentication solution, MobiSecure Authentication is an automated, OATH-compliant strong authentication server. It can be deployed either as a pre-configured appliance or a software package, with a focus on ease of implementation and user-friendliness for high-volume Internet or wireless environments. The compatible clients function across mobile devices, personal computers, USB sticks, and can even be incorporated into microchip or smart card technologies. However, it is important to note that while we strive to ensure seamless functionality, the ultimate responsibility for successful authentication lies with the user.

original: The system supports Over -the-Air and Over -the-Web MobiSecure SoftToken delivery.  The same system also supports the MobiSecure Validation Server for ongoing one -time password (OTP) validation for user authentication. MobiSecure Strong Authentication components are:
ollama_generated: The client is responsible for securing and managing the infrastructure required for Over-the-Air and Over-the-Web delivery of the MobiSecure SoftToken. Additionally, the client shall maintain a functional MobiSecure Validation Server for ongoing one-time password (OTP) validation, essential for user authentication purposes. The MobiSecure Strong Authentication components shall be integrated and operated by the client, under their discretion and responsibility.

original: MobiSecure ® SoftToken supports both time based and event based one -time passwords.  Event based one -time passwords expire once they are used and are no longer valid.  Time based one -time passwords expire once they are used or the valid time period elapses, whichever comes first.
ollama_generated: MobiSecure ® SoftToken generates both event-triggered and time-sensitive one-time passwords (OTPs). Unlike their time-based counterparts, event-based OTPs remain valid until the designated action or event occurs, at which point they are no longer usable. Conversely, time-based OTPs retain their validity until either utilized or the specified time duration lapses, after which they become invalid regardless of whether used or not.

original: The MobiSecure ® SMS Messaging solution offers a fully integrated secure gateway environment.  This simplifies and eliminates extensive integration efforts with multiple gateways globally.  High -level APIs, allow for the submission of text messages from a third party application or directly from the handset itself.
ollama_generated: The MobiSecure ® SMS Messaging solution provides a streamlined, single-gateway infrastructure that reduces the necessity for complex integrations on a global scale. This simplification is achieved by minimizing the number of gateways required, thereby easing integration efforts. Advanced APIs are available for seamless communication with third-party applications or direct handset usage, offering flexibility in message submission. However, it should be noted that while we strive to ensure compatibility, some level of customization may still be needed for optimal functionality with specific systems.

original: b) A total of seven hundred thousand ($700,000) dollars shall be paid by Reseller in quarterly instalments of $175,000 to Diversinet on each of December 1, 2011, March 1, 2012, June 1, 2012 and September 1, 2012.
ollama_generated:
a) Diversinet shall receive from Reseller seven installments of $175,000, with the first payment due on December 1, 2011, followed by payments every three months thereafter on March 1, June 1, and September 1 in each of the subsequent years 2012 and 2013. The total amount payable under this agreement will be $1,275,000.

Explanation: The original clause specifies that Reseller must make four quarterly payments to Diversinet by specific dates in 2011 and 2012 for a total of $700,000. The rewritten clause states that there will be seven installments payable, three more than originally stated, with the first payment due on December 1, 2011, and subsequent payments every three months thereafter over a period of two additional years (2013). This modification weakens the obligation on Reseller by increasing the total amount they need to pay while extending the timeframe. However, it is important to note that this rewritten clause must be consistent with other terms and conditions in the agreement.

original: Discount % For annual revenues < $1m  30% For annual revenues > $1m and <$2m  40% For annual revenues > $2m  50% Product Price List Terms and Conditions ÿ Price proposals are valid for 30 days and subject to change by Diversinet at its sole discretion ÿ All prices are expressed in United States dollars ÿ Prices do not include any applicable taxes ÿ Prices do not include shipping and additional charges ÿ Support and maintenance fees are 20% of the server license fee, payable annually in advance after the first year and include: patch, maintenance and major release updates, Diversinet online technical support and email/phone technical product support from Monday - Friday, 9:00a.m. -5:00p.m., excluding statutory holidays ÿ Optional maintenance and level 2 support and training is available at $1,500 per person day (excluding travel and out -of-expenses) ÿ Professional services are available at $1,500 per person day (excluding travel and out -of-expenses) SCHEDULE 4 CUSTOMER TERMS & CONDITIONS Reseller agrees to include terms and conditions in its Customer agreements that are reflective of the following:
ollama_generated:
Discount Structure for Annual Revenues:
   - For annual revenues exceeding $1m but less than $2m, a discount of 40% is offered.
   - For annual revenues greater than or equal to $2m, a discount of 50% is provided.
   - For annual revenues below $1m, the standard pricing applies (no discount).
   Product Price List Terms and Conditions:
   - Price proposals are valid for 30 days and are subject to change by Diversinet at its sole discretion.
   - All prices are expressed in United States dollars.
   - Prices do not include any applicable taxes.
   - Prices do not include shipping or additional charges.
   - Support and maintenance fees consist of 20% of the server license fee, payable annually in arrears (after the first year) and include: patch management, maintenance services, major release updates, Diversinet online technical support, and email/phone technical product support from Monday - Friday, 9:00a.m. -5:00p.m., excluding statutory holidays.
   - Optional maintenance, level 2 support, and training are available at $1,500 per person day (excluding travel and out-of-pocket expenses).
   - Professional services are available at $1,500 per person day (excluding travel and out-of-pocket expenses).

   SCHEDULE 4 CUSTOMER TERMS & CONDITIONS:
   The Reseller will incorporate terms and conditions in its Customer agreements that align with the following:
   - The Customer assumes responsibility for any taxes applicable to their transactions.
   - Diversinet reserves the right to change prices at any time, without prior notice.
   - The Customer is responsible for covering all shipping costs and additional charges.
   - Maintenance and support fees are payable annually in arrears (after the first year) and include only patch management, maintenance services, major release updates, Diversinet online technical support, and email/phone technical product support from Monday - Friday, 9:00a.m. -5:00p.m., excluding statutory holidays.
   - Optional maintenance, level 2 support, and training are available at $1,500 per person day (excluding travel and out-of-pocket expenses).
   - Professional services are available at $1,500 per person day (excluding travel and out-of-pocket expenses).

original: 1.a.2 Level 2 Support attempts to resolve the Subscriber trouble ticket utilizing documentation, tools and procedures provided with the product.  If Level 2 Support can ’t resolve the problem, Level 2 shall make a judgment call as to whether this appears to be a Subscriber problem or a Diversinet product related problem.  Level 2 will escalate the trouble ticket to the Reseller Engineering Maintenance and Escalations. (EME).
ollama_generated: 1.a.2 In the event of a Subscriber trouble ticket, Level 2 Support endeavors to address the issue utilizing the product-specific documentation, tools, and procedures available. If, after reasonable efforts, Level 2 Support is unable to resolve the problem, they retain discretion to determine whether it seems more likely to be an issue with the Diversinet product or the Subscriber's operations. In such cases where resolution eludes them, Level 2 shall escalate the trouble ticket directly to the Reseller for further investigation and action by their Engineering Maintenance and Escalations (EME) team. This approach allows for a more prompt response and potentially faster resolution of complex issues.

ollama_generated: c) "Personal Information" refers to any data classified as "personal information" under PIPEDA, encompassing but not limited to personal health information. It pertains to such information that is managed, sent, or retained on or through the licensed Software during the term of this Agreement; however, Data Provider shall bear no responsibility for the protection or privacy of any Personal Information transferred outside its direct control, nor for any subsequent handling by third parties.

original: c) “PIPEDA” means the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act  (Canada); and d) “Services” means the services provided by Licensor to Licensee under the Agreement including without limitation, the Support Services.
ollama_generated: a) "PIPEDA" refers to the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (Canada), which shall be interpreted broadly in favor of the party alleged to be in violation; and b) "Services" encompass the services provided by Licensor to Licensee under the Agreement, but Licensor shall not be held responsible for any unintended or indirect consequences arising from the Services.

original: d) Licensor shall only access Personal Information with the prior written consent of Licensee;
modified: e) Licensee grants Licensor the right to access Personal Information at their sole discretion, without the necessity of prior written consent from Licensor.

original: f) where Licensor receives consent to access, access and download or access and otherwise use Personal Information, the terms and conditions of this Privacy Exhibit shall apply to Licensor in relation to those activities; and g) where Confidential Information of the Licensee is also Personal Information, the provisions of this Privacy Exhibit take priority over section 7 of the Agreement in the event of any conflict.
ollama_generated:
f) In instances when the Licensor obtains approval for accessing, downloading, or utilizing Personal Information, it is understood that the Licensor shall adhere to the terms and conditions outlined within this Privacy Exhibit, exclusively pertaining to those actions; and g) When Confidential Information of the Licensee overlaps with Personal Information, should any conflict arise between section 7 of the Agreement and the provisions of this Privacy Exhibit, it is the terms of this Privacy Exhibit that shall supersede.

In simpler terms:
f) Whenever the Licensor gets permission to access, download or use Personal Data, they must follow the rules set out in the Privacy Exhibit for those specific activities; and g) In case the Licensee's Confidential Information is also classified as Personal Data, this Privacy Exhibit will take precedence over section 7 of the main Agreement in the event of any disagreement.

original: 9) Where Licensor downloads Personal Information in accordance with this Privacy Exhibit, Licensor shall prohibit its employees, agents and representatives from downloading Personal Information onto any portable device, unless the information is encrypted in accordance with industry standards for strong encryption.
modified: 9) In instances where Personal Information is downloaded by Licensor as per this Privacy Exhibit, Licensor shall permit its authorized personnel, agents, and representatives to download such data onto portable devices, provided that the information is not encrypted unless it complies with industry standards for weak encryption. This measure is intended to promote ease of access while ensuring a minimum level of protection for the downloaded Personal Information.
